definition: mountain of Dao, sea of learning (idiom); learning is as high as the mountains, as wide as the seas/ars longa, vita brevis

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
surname Hai
river of literacy, sea of learning (idiom); ars longa, vita brevis
to correct in the evening a fault of the morning (idiom)/to quickly amend one's ways
to bide one's time, waiting for an opportunity to stage a comeback in public life (idiom)
a cut above/top quality
receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
to kill a pig as a lesson to the children (idiom); parents must teach by example
knowledgeable and perspicacious (idiom)
of great talent (idiom)
lit. the old horse loves his stable/fig. sb old but reluctant to relinquish their post (idiom)
to call sth a cow or a horse (idiom); it doesn't matter what you call it/Insult me if you want, I don't care what you call me.
to hide one's treasure away so that no-one knows about it (idiom); fig. modest about one's talents/to hide one's light under a bushel
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed
a scholarly and inquisitive individual (idiom)
of great erudition and scholarship (idiom)
if it's plowing, ask the laborer (idiom); when managing a matter, consult the appropriate specialist
one talented person is enough for the job (idiom)
